pages.text: The effects of $(item)ruby$() immediately manifested themselves through my physical being. The armor that I forged from it filled my veins with a seizing anger, and compels me to $(thing)kill$(). I felt myself become stronger and more constituted in combat, like I myself could $(thing)sustain more attacks$() and keep fighting.
However, the rage that emboldened me couldn’t distract from the dread that resided in the back of my mind while I wore the ruby. I don’t like how it feels, but I want to wear it again...
Whereas diamond preserved itself by slowly mending its own wounds, ruby seemed to have a desire to preserve me above itself, slowly healing my own wounds.
